page.title: 03HARPER ADAMS COLLEGE EDGMOND
page.content: The{College Farm}including demonstration areas has 139. 14 Hectares and the Garden Buildings, Roads and Woodlands have 17.91 Hectares. The college has 120 Dairy cows, used for breeding, 140 ewes, for research and having lambs. Wheat, barley, potato and sugar-beet are grown in rotation. 150 sows are raised for bacon. There is also a{poultry unit,}used in teaching. It has pure breeds and breeding flocks. There are incubating buildings, two deep-pit battery units with a capacity of 10,000 birds and another two small units with 3,000 birds. Most of the eggs produced are sold to a packing station, but there is a farm shop. Broilers,capons, turkeys, ducks and geese are also kept. Subjects investigated are size, weight and diet.
